Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(user: User, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on the user_id and contact_id.
Args:

user (User): The User object that is requesting to get a Contact by id. contact_id (int): The id of the Contact being requested. db (Session): A Session instance for interacting with our database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that we want to get

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the contacts of a specific user

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The remove function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.set_favorite(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactFavoriteModel, db: Session)¶
The set_favorite function sets the favorite status of a contact.
Args:

user (User): The user who is making the request. contact_id (int): The ID of the contact to set as a favorite or not. body (ContactFavoriteModel): A model containing whether or not to set this as a favorite, and if so, what type of favoriting it should be.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact from the database

  • body – ContactFavoriteModel: Pass the is_favorite value to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The update function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactModel: Pass in the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Trelent
